sentences.en: Allied M 8 Armored Car Armor upgrade Munitions cost reduced by 25.
sentences.cn: 美军M8装甲车的装甲升级所需弹药资源减少25.

sentences.en: Any arms, munitions, living plants , or animals?
sentences.cn: 有武器弹药和活的动植物 吗 ?

sentences.en: Before Song Dynasty, the provision of munitions was linked with traditional agriculture.
sentences.cn: 宋代以前, 军需供应与传统农业紧密结合.

sentences.en: Bombers, 430 Tanks, 3350 Vehicles, and approximately 100,000 tons of Munitions.
sentences.cn: 210架轰炸机, 430辆坦克, 3350辆卡车和大约10万吨军需品.

sentences.en: He was hired by a munitions factory.
sentences.cn: 他被一家生产军需品的工厂雇佣.

sentences.en: Here, you see 15 munitions bunkers in yellow and red outlines.
sentences.cn: 从这里, 你们可以看见15个黄色轮廓和红色轮廓的弹药掩体.

sentences.en: Panzer Elite Scout Car Logistik Upgrade decreased in cost from 40 munitions to 25 munitions.
sentences.cn: 装甲精英侦察车后勤升级弹药消耗由40降低为25.

sentences.en: Registered Artillery now costs 125 Munitions to call from 150.
sentences.cn: 防御学的预定点炮击技能消耗由150弹药降低到125.

sentences.en: Ships carrying essential supplies and munitions steamed continuously across the Atlantic.
sentences.cn: 载着粮食和军用品的船只不断地开过大西洋.

sentences.en: The army used precision - guided munitions to blow up enemy targets.
sentences.cn: 军队用精确瞄准的枪炮炸掉敌方目标.

sentences.en: The blockading ships prevented delivery of munitions.
sentences.cn: 封锁船封锁港口,阻止军需物品的运送.

sentences.en: We know that this one has housed chemical munitions.
sentences.cn: 我们获悉,这一处设施一直藏有化学武器.

sentences.en: Your resources here revolve around manpower , munitions, and fuel.
sentences.cn: 在游戏中你需关注的资源包括人力 、 军需品和燃料.

words.tran_cn: [军]军需品（尤指武器弹药）；必需品（munition的复数）

trans.tran_cn: 弹药，军火，军需品，必需品(munition的复数)，必需的设备的供应
trans.tran_en: military supplies such as bombs and guns

trans.tran_cn: 供应…军需品；从事军需品生产（munition的三单形式）
